Location Field Notes: Below main 3S confluence. The boat left from Stung Treng and we sampled in the middle of the mainstem.
Above main 3S confluence. We sampled about 1 mile upstream of the confluence from our boat.
Sekong just below Sekong and Srepok confluence.
Above Sekong and Srepok confluence on the Sekong. Water was flowing realtively fast with the sample taken from the middle of the channel by boat.
Above Sekong and Srepok confluence on the Srepok. Water relatively still relatively fast in Jan with a wide channel at this point on the Srepok.

Just below dam below the Sesan and Srepok confluence on the Srepok. It took a few hours to access this spot and we were met at gun point by dam security. Permission in advance will be required for this location in the future and high flows may be an issue.
Replicate
Replicate
Blank
Above the Sesan and Srepok confluence. A fisherman took us out for only a few dollars to sample from the middle of the river near the fishing village.

Above the Sesan and Srepok confluence. We sampled above the bridge crossing the Sesan at this point but there is no town. We "borrowed" a boat to sample in the main channel that had relatively low flows.
Upstream on the Srepok near Lumphat. There was no access to a functioning boat so we sampled off the bank above the bridge.
Upstream Sesan near Virochey. Despite there being a village we could not hire a boat so I waded to my waist and sampled just outside the town.
Upstream Sekong near Siem pang. The river was still very large and relatively slow at this point and we sampled by boat.
Near Kracheh in dolphin pool on the mainstem Mekong. We used one of the tourist boats to go to the middle of the channel to sample but the mains stem was rather braided at that point.
Near Kampong Cham on the main stem Mekong. Access to a boat was challenging but we found a fishermen along the water that took us to the middle of the river.
Took sample off the person ferry just below the bridge while the ferry was in motion.

Fisherman took us from his house. Access along the Basak from the highway is not consistent and access by boat is not easy. We asked a few folks with no luck but found two fisherman for these points willing to take us out for a few dollars.
Fisherman took us from his house
Above confluence with the TSR on the Mekong mainstem. We went up a few miles to try to make sure we were not sampling TSR water on the mainstem.
Above confluence with the MM on the TSR just below the bridge near Phnom Penh.
South end of lake above Chunok Tru. We went into open water so we were essentially sampling the southern end of the lake at that time of year.
4 km up the Sen near Chunok Tru. We went up river enough to try to be capturing only Sen water. Flow was slow.
Blank (Kampong Chhnong). These samples were taken from a tourist boat in the main channel with flow being relatively slow.
Sampled off Tourist Boat (Kampong Chhnong)
Replicate (Kampong Chhnong)
Replicate (Kampong Chhnong)
Tributary to Mekong ~ 15 km upstream of Mukdahan.  Collected mussels and clams from beach on Mekong DS of trib (mixed water).
Mekong ~ 5 km upstream of Mukdahan Bridge.  Samples from Boat at surface (~0.25 m).
Mekong ~ 5 km upstream of Mukdahan Bridge.  Samples from Boat at surface (~0.25 m).
Mekong mainsten upstream on Nam Gam tributary.  On river right.  Very slow water and downstream of town.  Sampled from boat at 0.5 m depth.  Clealy Mekong water.

Tailwaters of Nam Gam dam.  No water spilling so is likely to be mostly Mekong water. Slow movement.  Clam and Mussel samples from lady harvesting in the banks -- may show seaosnal signal of the dam release.
In Nam Gam reservoir just upstream of dam.  Taken from stairs down tot water.  Totally calm water.

Site Name: Nam Gam and Nam Bang confluence
Location Field Notes: Confluence of Nam Gam and Nam Bang rivers.  No flow.  All slack water.  One sample taken in midle of the confluence.  Bivalves taken from mud near confluence on Nam Gam.

Nam Oun ~ 2km upstream of Nam Songkhram.  Slow water with no flow.  Near rice agriculture.  High sediment.  Shells and snails from beach.  Upstream of Nam Oun dam.  Area floods during wet season with large floodplain.
Nam Songkhram at Tha Bo village.  Low flow.  Sample taken off dock near middle of river.  Possible local pollution.  Shells from beach near site.
Nam Songkhram at Tha Bo village.  Low flow.  Sample taken off dock near middle of river.  Possible local pollution.  Shells from beach near site.
Songkhram River about 10 km upstream of confluence with Mekong.  Sampled just upstream of bridge and talapia cages.  Slow water.  Very green.  Lots of periphyton.
Chai Buri Village on Mekong.  Sampled off of resturant in very fast water.  Good sample.  Triplicate samples plus blank.
Chai Buri Village on Mekong.  Sampled off of resturant in very fast water.  Good sample.  Triplicate samples plus blank.
Chai Buri Village on Mekong.  Sampled off of resturant in very fast water.  Good sample.  Triplicate samples plus blank.

Nam Mun near mouth just downstream of rock barrier.  Very deep (~60m).  Missed GPS waypoint.  Marked about 650m downstream of sampling site.  Collected bivales at maark which are from a good location.
Mekong upstream of confluence with Nam Mun.  Sampled in very fast current.  Many sand islands.  Clearly Mekong water.  Collected bivalves on island in the river: 15.32096  105.51427
Mekong upstream of confluence with Nam Mun.  Sampled in very fast current.  Many sand islands.  Clearly Mekong water.  Collected bivalves on island in the river: 15.32096  105.51427
In the middle of town taken at the park from shore.  Could be bogus.  High SpCond.
Nam Mun upstream of Nam Chi.  Good flow.  Not very deep.  Good sample.  Clear water.  Bivalves taken just upstream of Chiﾅprobably okay.
Nam Chi well upstream of Nam Mun.  Very different water color.  Lots of light sediment.  Bivalve sample from Chi but very close to confluenceﾅcould be problematic.
Siem Reap River just upstream of Siem Reap town.
Sreng River sampled just downstream of highway bridge in fast flowing water.  Good sample.  Apparently there has been lotsof irrigation development upstream.
Sisophon River which is a tributary to the Sangker River.  Very slow and nasty water.  Collected about 3 m from the edge at 1 m deep.
Mongol Borey River which is a tributary to the Sangker River.  Locals say it only flows in the wet season.  Very stagnant and polluted.
Sangker River upstream of Battambang town.  Slow water.
Sangker River downstream of Battambang town.  Slow water.
Pursat River downstream of Pursat Town.  Below diversion barrier.
Pursat River downstream of Pursat Town.  Below diversion barrier.
Tonle Sap offshore from Kampong Luong.  Roughly 30 minute ride from town.  Close to middle of lake.
Baribour River at highway bridge.  Good sample in moving water.
Chinit River upstream of highway bridge.  Slow flow but moving.  Periphyton on rocks. Good site.  Collected bivalves.  Upstream looks fairly less impacted.
Sen River downstream of highway bridge.  Slow flow but moving.  Taken from middle of river.  Good sample.  No bivalves.
Tonle Sap Lake in open water at north end.
